data.title: Very good but no salad or soup
data.text: We ordered carry out from the restaurant. The cheese ravioli and baked pasta were delicious. For the price I was disappointed that the meals did not include soup or salad. The small loaf of bread was cold and hard, perhaps it is better if you dine in.

data.title: Delicious flat bread and meatball sandwiches
data.text: Great atmosphere at this place this lunch time . Quick service and choice of table although busy . I had the margarita flatbread and added mushrooms . Wow it was good . Hot , crispy but still moist on top . My friend had the basil tomato soup and meatball half sandwich. She enjoyed both . Great value and great food . I would definitely visit again .

data.title: Good place for an Italian Dinner
data.text: MAKE A Reservation.   Walk ins are welcome but the wait is longer depending on the night.   A full menu of different Italian dishes.  They do have a set of dishes that have you get one and take one home.   Instead of a doggy bag they are prepared to take home.   The staff was awesome and prices reasonable.   The atmosphere  was great.

data.title: Good food at The Maggs
data.text: A bit busy we had to wait a few minutes to be seated there wasn't anyone to greet us at the entrance, once seated the service was speedy and accurate, we chose the lasagna dinner, Great choice! We didn't leave a spec on our plates. Thanks Maggianos I will be back with friends and family on my next visit.

data.title: Great food, but far too much & poor service
data.text:
I was there with a group of 10 or so, and tables of 8 are more are urged (forced is more like it) to choose the more expensive "family style" option. To be clear here: When we were seated, the menus were opened to the family style page, which explained that groups are encouraged to order off that page. When we asked about ordering individually, the waiter looked exasperated and we were essentially told that wasn't an option.

While very tasty, the amount of food was hugely unreasonable - far more than would be appropriate for a group our size. We could have fed 20 people. This might have been considered a plus if we could have taken home leftovers, but as our group was all from out of town and staying in hotels for one night only, this was a huge waste. I would NEVER order the family style again, and if they tried to insist, I would push back HARD.  

Additionally, our server was highly inattentive... Example: After discussing beer options with the server and ordering a local beer, I had to ask three times over the span of 20 minutes where my beer was after the others at our table had already been served their drinks.  Each time the response was, "Oh yes, I'm on my way to get it." If he was too busy, shame on him for not asking for more help, or at least acknowledging it.  And shame on his management for allowing it to continue.

Was the food good? Yes. Was the atmosphere nice? Yes. Would I go back? Hardly -- the Denver area has many great dining choices, and once here was enough. Maybe I'll try another Maggiano's another time, but I'll never choose to return to this one if I can help it.

data.title: Stopped for a Drink
data.text: We were only able to stay for a drink at the bar, but the food looked and smelled great!  The bartender (Daniel?) was very helpful with wine and cocktail selections.  We will definitely visit again for dinner.

data.title: Exceeded our expectations
data.text: The atmosphere is relaxed and friendly - the server was (just-right) attentive and friendly.  The food was fantastic!  The hostess was so helpful when I said I thought I had lost a bracelet - she went the extra mile.  It was our first time at any Magianno's, and we were prompted to return to the franchise in Chicago.

data.title: Awesome
data.text: My wife and I went for a nice Sunday early dinner. The atmosphere is fantastic. The staff was perfect. And the food is delicious. Save room for the butter cake OMG.

data.title: Very good food with great service
data.text: Last week I took in-laws to Maggiano's.  We had great service and the food was wonderful, as always. 2 of the 4 of us wanted Gluten-Free and they were accommodated with a wide selection of options. We loved the take-home special menu where you get a regular meal then a second meal to take home. It can be the same item or a completely different one PLUS you get your leftovers to take. Can't lose!

data.title: Love this place!
data.text: We always have a great meal here with an attentive staff. They offer great suggestions and are willing to make changes to your needs. Love the eggplant parmigiana here!

data.title: It seems a little confused.
data.text:
We hadn't been to Maggiano's in a few years but remembered it as being a bit upscale with good Italian food. I was surprised when I tried to get an Open Table rezzie for 6:30 on a Saturday night and found either 5:00 or 8:00. I forgot about homecoming weekend. That said, it was our anniversary so we took the 5:00 as the other is just getting too late for us anymore. The reason I mention that it seems a little confused is partially to blame on the mix of people there. There appeared to be almost as many people in jeans and Tee-shirts/jerseys as not and I actually got some stares since I was in a sports coat.

Our table was ready on time although it was a while before the waiter came by. He was good overall but it was pretty hit or miss with long gaps between visits, especially as he got busier. He explained the menu well, including the specials. Another item that prompted the confused comment is they have a group of selections on the menu that include a "pasta gift to take home" which I didn't think was described very well. I didn't know if we were getting a box of uncooked spaghetti or what. I guess they are competing with Olive Garden and if you choose an entree from this given category you get a second entree boxed to go. I will admit it was a great deal price wise although their portion sizes often prompt a to go box anyway..

It took a very long time to get a cocktail. They start you off with some Italian Bread with olive oil and optional balsamic  vinegar. Grind your own pepper. The Italian Salad was OK. Nothing wrong but the dressing was a little boring for me. Again, grind your own pepper. Their Lasagna is very good. The Fettuccine with Seafood was a very large portion with lot of mussels, some clams, good size shrimp, and a smattering of squid and lobster. I think I would have liked a little more flavor to the broth and maybe a hint of tomato to it but it was good. Although Carrot Cake was on the October Specials menu it would have been a $5 upcharge to go with the package deal. We ended up with a piece of Cheesecake to go. Their wine menu is good and most bottles are in the $30-$40 range. The list included a nice selection of quality cocktails. Maybe it's a case if you have to ask, you can't afford them, but I think prices could be included with the description. I never did look to see what my Rye Manhattan ran.

I am glad we went early. By the time we left it was packed and there seemed to be some confusion with food coming out for other table either incorrectly or poorly timed. I will say that the high school aged patrons looked very sharp in their homecoming dresses and ties.

data.title: Delicious
data.text: A coworker and I ate dinner at this Maggiano's and really enjoyed our meals.  We split one of the flat bread appetizers and salad was delicious.  The restaurant was very crowded so we ate at the bar and the service was friendly and prompt.

data.title: Filling
data.text: The portions here are huge. Come with an appetite. The food was ok. I had the vegetarian pasta and the vegetables were a little undercooked. My wife had the shrimp scampi which was pretty good. The wine list is pretty basic. Our server was very nice. The place is pretty expensive.

data.title: Old fashioned and good
data.text:
Interior design reminds me of a mafia movie...

Family style portions of tasty homemade pasta, great sauce and large Italian American portions. 

Mushroom Ravioli was excellent, and they give you the same portion size to take home; concept is that Italian families always cook too much food to share...

Restaurant was busy and has a good vibe. 

Server in restaurant was good, but bar area waitress overcharged me for my wine.

data.title: Whoa, what a night!!!!
data.text:
Took my family here for dinner.  The waitress took over twenty minutes to even come to our table and greet us.
We placed our order, and it took forever for our food to be brought to us.  Then the waitress never checked back on us.  My daughter, whose food by now, was getting pretty cold had to be remade.  We spoke with the waitress and she was rude to us and then I asked to see the manager. When the manager came I explained our concerns, and she was very kind to us.  She remade the food and packaged it up for our trek back to the Springs.  My daughter was very hungry but would wait until we got home.  The waitress kept glaring at us all night as she had been spoken to by management.  The worst night out ever.

data.title: Love it!!!!!
data.text: Best Italian family celebration spot in the south metro area! Love when we met Chef Eric! First time visiting and we received an appetiser hand delivered by Eric.

data.title: We had a table for 11. Great service. No complaints
data.text: There was a group of 11 for dinner. The service was fantastic. The waiters were attentive to the adults and the children equally. .Great food

data.title: Great atmosphere and food food
data.text: Came here abt 9:30pm with my wife.  Surprisingly we struggled to find a nice place still open.  I enjoy the fresh flavors of the classics and the addition of buy one take one home for $11 was a tremendous deal

data.title: Service doesn't keep up with food.
data.text:
We stopped here on our way to Beaver Creek on September 17th. The restaurant was not very busy in the afternoon and we were seated quickly, however it was about 15 minutes before our waiter (Danny) came to our table. 2 other tables we could see were seated after us and had water and bread before we saw our waiter. We saw several employees, not sure they were waitstaff visiting with each other in bar area. 

Finally we were able to order. My wife ordered bruschetta as an appetizer and we also all ordered salads. When our salads came we had to ask about the bruschetta. They then brought it just shortly before our entrees. 

The bruschetta was not as good as it usually has been but the rest of the food was great as always. The very poor and slow service made this our least enjoyable visit ever to Maggiano's. We have been to there locations in several states and several locations but have always received good service in the past. 

If you visit this location I hope you get a different waiter than we did.

data.title: Yum!
data.text: Stopped here very late and was so hungry. This restaurant never disappoints. The food is delicious!!!!
